item.title: Google Trends Visualization using R
item.description: This post is about visualizing using maps. First of all, we need some packages. For capturing the google search hits, we use gtrendsR. To get the world map, we use R package called maps. ggplot2is used for visualizing the map. # install.packages("maps", "ggplot2", "tidyverse", "devtools") # devtools::install_github('PMassicotte/gtrendsR') library(gtrendsR) library(maps) library(ggplot2) library(tidyverse) Obtain World Map Information Here in this section, we global <- map_data("world") #World longitude and latitude data head(global) #view the data and notice the column of long, lat, and group ## long lat group order region subregion ## 1 -69.
